result.execSummary:
The defendant Soroce J. King was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Upon successful completion of probation, record may be expunged, 973.015.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
DNA sample to be provided.  DE to complete domestic abuse/anger management counseling and any other counseling or treatment per agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Soroce J. King

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: & Satisfaction of Probation Conditions for Expungment
Cover Letter from DOC agent Meissner

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: allow temp. foreign travel for school stud abroad in Scotland

Defendant Soroce J. King in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Court notes he has reviewed the motion filed by DE re: being allowed to travel.  Atty Tsai makes brief argument.  State isn't opposed but after speaking w/DOC they wanted to make the Court aware of a few things.  Parties discuss.  Court grants the motion to allow out of country travel as requested but admonishes the DE re: all conditions previously ordered to remain in place while the DE is traveling.  Atty Tsai to provide order for the Court to sign.
to allow short term foreign travel

Defendant Soroce J. King in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State states recs.  Atty Tsai is in agreement.  NC plea entered.  DE is in agreement.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty.  State notes victim was noticed.  Atty Tsai makes statement on behalf of DE.  Court sentences.

Ct 1:  Dismissed/read-in
Ct 2:  NC - amended to include domestic abuse
Probation for 18 months
Conditions of probation:
$543.00 costs/surcharges to be paid per agent
DNA sample to be provided
Domestic Abuse/Anger Management counseling and any other counseling/treatment per agent
If successful the matter may be expunged under 973.015

Defendant Soroce J. King in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Tsai believes matter will be resolved but needs one week reset to review docs w/client.  Bond continued.  Return date scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Soroce J. King from LEC by video with attorney Puck Tsai.  Defendant Soroce J. King in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $500.00 signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No violent/abusive contact w/D.Y. and absolute sobriety at all times.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
